page.title: 09COMPUTING IN KENDAL
page.content: The age of computing at the moment in Kendal does not affect people already in a job by making them unemployed but fewer people are being taken on as the use of computers expands. The town, having diverse occupations, has not had the large scale redundancies affecting larger cities. 40% of pupils in Kirkbie Kendal School own a computer. The school uses BBC model Bs and Electrons. The best selling home computers in Kendal are Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum and Electrons. They are mostly used in Kendal for games by children and for small businesses. The biggest selling game at the moment is Elite for all three computers. In Kendal there are three computer shops, Ace Computers, Kendal Computer Centre and WH Smith's computer department.
